automata

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • automata.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a (n * m) circular grid. This model contains cells depicted with their position. The grid is circular, meaning that the (n, m) cell can interact with the (1, 1) cell. The size of the grid is fixed at the instanciation.
    See Also:
    Cell

    • Method Detail

      • computeNextGeneration

        public void computeNextGeneration()
        Computes the next generation of the cellular automaton from current states of cells.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the cells of the grid. Cells are instanciated in the whole 2D grid.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restarts the grid. To restart a grid, just restart each of its cells. Restarting a cell means assigning the cell its first state.

      • draw

        public void draw(gui.GUISimulator gui,
                 int cellSize,
                 boolean withSquares)
        Draws the grid and the cells inside.
        Parameters:
        gui - The graphic user interface to draw in
        cellSize - The size of a cell, in pixels
        withSquares - If true, draws a grid pattern in the GUI

      • drawCells

        public void drawCells(gui.GUISimulator gui,
                      int cellSize)
        Draws the cells.
        Parameters:
        gui - The graphic user interface to draw in
        cellSize - The size of a cell, in pixels

      • get

        public Cell get(int i,
                int j)
        Cell getter.
        Parameters:
        i - The vertically i^th cell
        j - The horizontally j^th cell
        Returns:
        The cell at the position (i, j)

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Height getter.
        Returns:
        The vertical number of cells

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Width getter.
        Returns:
